isis.stitle: TSI 00-16-03 - Water Between the View Window Glass Panels of the Passenger Door

subjectgroup.subject: Water Between the View Window Glass Panels of the Passenger Door

geninfo.para: 5000i and 9000i Models have a view window located in the bottom front corner of the passenger door ( Figure 1). This view window is comprised of an outer glass panel located on the door outer skin and an inner, vented, glass panel located on the door trim panel ( Figure 2).

Water droplets from rain or condensation may collect on the surfaces of the view window glass inside the door ( Figure 2). THIS OCCURRENCE IS CONSIDERED NORMAL. Water will drain out through two holes located in the bottom of the door. In addition, the inside view window glass panel has two vent openings to allow cab air to circulate between the inner and outer glass panels to clear condensation from these surfaces.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: It is recommended that the inner surfaces of the view window glass panels be periodically cleaned.

step1.para: Remove the four mounting screws from the inner view window panel ( Figure 1).
Remove the glass panel from the door inner trim panel.
Clean the inner surfaces of both glass panels and re-install.
